histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.AllowTextMessages.Policy.SuppressionState
histogram.summary: Records the policy text message suppression state. This is emitted whenever the text message suppression value is changed via policy.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.AllowTextMessages.TextMessageNotificationSuppressionState
histogram.summary: Records the received text message notification suppression state. This is emitted whenever a text message notification is received.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.AllowTextMessages.User.SuppressionState
histogram.summary: Records the user text message suppression state. This is emitted whenever the text message suppression value is changed by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CreateCustomApn.ApnTypes
histogram.summary: Records the APN types of an APN. This is emitted each time a user creates a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CreateCustomApn.AuthenticationType
histogram.summary: Records the authentication type of an APN. This is emitted each time a user creates a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CreateCustomApn.IpType
histogram.summary: Records the IP type of an APN. This is emitted each time a user creates a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CreateCustomApn.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to create a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CustomApns.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of APNs saved for a cellular network every time a cellular network successfully connects.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.CustomApns.{CustomApnState}.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of {CustomApnState} APNs saved for a cellular network every time a cellular network successfully connects.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.DisableCustomApn.ApnTypes
histogram.summary: Records the APN types of an APN before modification. This is emitted each time a user disables a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.DisableCustomApn.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to disable a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.EnableCustomApn.ApnTypes
histogram.summary: Records the APN types of an APN before modification. This is emitted each time a user enable a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.EnableCustomApn.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to enable a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.Managed.MigrationType
histogram.summary: Records the type of migration that occurs for each APN that's migrated for managed devices. This metric is emitted when a managed network is migrated from the old APN UI to new APN UI.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.ModifyCustomApn.ApnTypes
histogram.summary: Records the APN types of an APN before modification. This is emitted each time a user modifies a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.ModifyCustomApn.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to modify a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.RemoveCustomApn.ApnTypes
histogram.summary: Records the APN types of an APN. This is emitted each time a user removes a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.RemoveCustomApn.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to remove a custom APN.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.Apn.Unmanaged.MigrationType
histogram.summary: Records the type of migration that occurs for each APN that's migrated for unmanaged devices. This metric is emitted when an unmanaged network is migrated from the old APN UI to new APN UI.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ConfigurationFailure.Type
histogram.summary: Tracks the type of cellular configuration failures that occur when connecting to a cellular network.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ConnectionResult.{CustomApnsStatus}.All
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of network connection attempts for cellular networks and whether they have at least one enabled custom APN or not. A success is emitted when a cellular network becomes connected from a non-connected state. When a cellular network goes from a connecting state to a disconnected state without a user initiated disconnect, a shill failure reason is emitted.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.PolicyInstall.Method
histogram.summary: Records the method of installation used to attempt to install an eSIM profile. This is emitted once for each initial installation attempt of the eSIM profile corresponding to a policy-defined network.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.PolicyInstall.{UserErrorHandling}.{Method}
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to install an eSIM profile. This is emitted once for each installation attempt of the eSIM profile corresponding to a policy-defined network. The "included" variant will always be emitted to; the "filtered" variant, however, will not be emitted to when the result was due to an Hermes failure that was caused by something outside the control of ChromeOS, e.g. an invalid activation code.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.SmdsScan.ProfileCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of eSIM profiles discovered by SM-DS scans. This will be emitted once for each installation attempt; this means that if multiple SM-DS servers are scanned for an installation attempt the count emitted will be the total number of profiles discovered across all scanned servers.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.SmdsScan.{SmdsType}.{UserErrorHandling}
histogram.summary: Records the result of a single SM-DS scan of a single SM-DS server. The {SmdsType} token indicates the type of SM-DS server that was scanned, and the {UserErrorHandling} token indicates the result filtering used, if any. The "included" variant will always be emitted to; the "filtered" variant, however, will not be emitted to when the result was due to an Hermes failure that was caused by something outside the control of ChromeOS, e.g. an invalid activation code.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.SmdsScanDuration.{SmdsType}.{DurationType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time taken to perform a single SM-DS scan of a single SM-DS server. The {SmdsType} token indicates the type of SM-DS server that was scanned, and the {DurationType} token indicates whether this duration was for a scan that ompleted with an Hermes result that indicates a non-fatal error occurred. An error does not necessarily indicate that the scan failed, but does indicate that there was an issue when performing the scan, e.g., there was an issue with one of the profiles discovered.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.UserInstall.Method
histogram.summary: Records the method of installation used to attempt to install an eSIM profile. This is emitted once for each installation attempt of an eSIM profile using the consumer UI.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.ESim.UserInstall.{UserErrorHandling}.{Method}
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to install an eSIM profile. This is emitted once for each installation attempt of an eSIM profile using the consumer UI. The "included" variant will always be emitted to; the "filtered" variant, however, will not be emitted to when the to when the result was due to an Hermes failure that was caused by something outside the control of ChromeOS, e.g. an invalid activation code.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.SimLock.Policy.Notification.Event
histogram.summary: Records events on the notification shown when the SIM is locked and admin has restricted users from PIN locking their SIMs. These are emitted once the notification is shown and once when the user interacts with it.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.SimLock.Policy.Notification.LockType
histogram.summary: Records the type of SIM lock affecting a cellular network when a user is notified that the cellular network is SIM locked.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Cellular.SimLock.Policy.{PinLockPolicy}.ActiveSIMLockStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of the SIM (Unlocked/PIN Locked/PUK Blocked) upon a change in cellular connection.
This metric will be recorded upon following transitions: 1. no connection to new connection; 2. connection_1 to connection_2

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.SetConfig.OperationResult
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the result of setting hotspot configuration. Emitted whenever attempts to update hotspot configuration.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Capability.AllowStatus
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the hotspot allow status on the cellular-capable devices. This metric is emitted each time the allow status is updated, for example: when user connects/disconnect to a cellular network, enterprise policy applied, etc.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Capability.AllowStatusAtLogin
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the hotspot allow status on the cellular-capable devices only when user logins in. This metric is emitted after a 5 minutes delay when user login which gives the user enough time to connect to their upstream cellular network.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.CheckReadiness.OperationResult
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the result of checking tethering readiness. Emitted whenever attempts to check tehtering readiness, for exmaple: when cellular network get connected or when enable hotspot.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Disabled.Reason
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the causes of disabled hotspot. Emitted each time the hotspot becomes disabled.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Enabled.UpstreamStatus
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the upstream status the when hotspot is start up. Emitted each time the hotspot starts successfully.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.EnableHotspot.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks how long the user needs to wait once the hotspot is requested to turn on until the hotspot is ready to use.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.Config.AutoDisable
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the number of whether the hotspot auto disable configuration is set for usage. Emitted each time the hotspot starts successfully.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.Config.CompatibilityMode
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the number of whether the hotspot extend compatibility mode is set for usage. Emitted each time the hotspot starts successfully.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.Config.MAR
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the number of whether the hotspot BSSID randomization configuration is set for usage. Emitted each time the hotspot starts successfully.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks how long users use hotspot per session. Emitted whenever the hotspot is torn down.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.ManagedStateWhenHotspotEnabled
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the number of the hotspot being used on a managed device or not. Emitted each time the hotspot starts successfully.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.Usage.MaxConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of maximum connected device count per hotspot session. Emitted whenever the hotspot session is torn down.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.Hotspot.Upstream.Cellular.{Operation}.OperationResult
histogram.summary: Measures and tracks the result of turning on/off hotspot. Emitted whenever attempts to enabled/disabled hotspot.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.VPN.{VPNProviderType}.ConfigurationSource
histogram.summary: Logs the configuration source (i.e., the user vs. policy) for VPN networks. Emitted when a VPN is configured.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.WiFi.Hidden.RemovalAttempt
histogram.summary: Records the number of WiFi networks that were determined to be wrongly configured as hidden and were attempted to be removed. This metric will be emitted each time we check for wrongly configured networks which happens once at startup and each time the primary user changes.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.WiFi.Hidden.RemovalAttempt.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of an attempt to remove a WiFi network that was determined to be wrongly configured as hidden. This metric will be emitted for each network we attempt to remove if and when we are notified of the result of our removal request; while it is safe to expect that we will be notified most of the time, we are not guaranteed to be notified. These network removals will occur once at startup and each time the primary user changes.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.WiFi.Hidden.{LoginStatus}
histogram.summary:
Logs whether the network in question is configured as hidden or not. Emitted when a network is newly configured.
Note: This histogram was wrongly emitted for all network configurations when it should have only been emitted for new network configurations. This issue was resolved on 2023-07-19.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{NetworkType}.ConnectionResult.All
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of all Network connection attempts. A success is emitted when a network of type {NetworkType} becomes connected from a non-connected state. When a network of type {NetworkType} goes from a connecting state to a disconnected state without a user initiated disconnect, a shill failure reason is emitted.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{NetworkType}.ConnectionResult.NonUserInitiated
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of automatic Network connection attempts. A success is emitted when a network of type {NetworkType} becomes connected from a non-connected state without user action.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{NetworkType}.ConnectionResult.UserInitiated
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of a user initiated connection attempt. Logged when a network of type {NetworkType} connection succeeds or fails.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{NetworkType}.DisconnectionsWithoutUserAction
histogram.summary: Tracks when a network of type {NetworkType} is connected and when a network of type {NetworkType} is disconnected without explicit user action.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{NetworkType}.DisconnectionsWithoutUserAction.ShillError
histogram.summary: Tracks the Shill error provided as the disconnection reason when a network of type {NetworkType} becomes disconnected without any user interaction.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{TechnologyType}.EnabledState.{Operation}.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the rate of success of performing the {Operation} operation on the shill associated {TechnologyType} technology type.

histogram.name: Network.Ash.{TechnologyType}.EnabledState.{Operation}.ResultCode
histogram.summary: This metric is emitted when users perform {Operation} operation on the {TechnologyType} technology. We capture all result codes returned by the platform API.

histogram.name: Network.CaptivePortalResult
histogram.summary: Captive portal detection state from Shill received by NetworkState. NOTE: This metric used to be CaptivePortal.NetworkPortalDetectorResult which was expired from 2021-04-01 to 2022-09-18.

histogram.name: Network.CaptivePortalStatusCode
histogram.summary: Captive portal status code reported by Shill and received by NetworkState. NOTE: This metric used to be CaptivePortal.NetworkStateStatusCode which was expired from 2021-04-01 to 2022-09-18.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.Apn.UseAttachApnOnSave
histogram.summary: ChromeOS cellular network metric that tracks the Attach APN Toggle value when the user explicitly clicks the Save button in the 'Other' APN settings, with the intent of setting the cellular network APN properties.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.ConfigurationStateAfterInitialization
histogram.summary: Emitted each time Carrier Lock Manager was successfully initialized and a new configuration process was started (only when Manager is not disabled and device has cellular modem).

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.Error.{ErrorType}
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the error occurs during manager initialization, modem seup, OOBE stage or communication with FCM, PSM and provisioning servers.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.FcmCommunicationResult
histogram.summary: Emitted each time registration or subscription to FCM topic was successful.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.FcmNotificationType
histogram.summary: Emitted on every notification received from FCM service.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.LockState
histogram.summary: Emitted when the property SimLockStatus was updated. State of LockType will tell if the modem is carrier-locked (but only if an incompatible SIM is inserted) and the internal disable flag of Carrier Lock Manager will tell whether the modem should be configured.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.ModemConfigurationResult
histogram.summary: Emitted each time the modem was successfully configured.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.NumConsecutiveConfigurationFailures
histogram.summary: Emits current number of failures every time the error counter (any cause of failure) reaches multiple of 10. It will help detect false negative (modem unlocked and config locked) failure which can happen when the modem was not properly configured.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.OobeDevModeResult
histogram.summary: Emitted each time OOBE successfully checks PSM and configures dev-mode

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.ProvisioningServerResponse
histogram.summary: Emitted each time lock configuration was downloaded from Provisioning server.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.PsmClaimResponse
histogram.summary: Emitted each time PSM service was requested about device membership.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.CarrierLock.{ConsecutiveFailuresType}
histogram.summary: Emitted when the modem was successfully locked or unlocked. It reports the cumulative number of attempts made before successful configuration.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.DisableProfile.Result
histogram.summary:
Tracks the success rate of disabling an eSIM profile. Note that the result for "already disabled" is considered a success for this metric.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.EnableProfile.Result
histogram.summary:
Tracks the success rate of enabling an eSIM profile. Note that the result for "already enabled" is considered a success for this metric.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Installation.NonUserErrorSuccessRate
histogram.summary:
This metric is emitted when user attempts to install an eSIM profile. We record all hermes response status codes that are within our control. User and Carrier related errors such as invalid qr code, malformed carrier response are omitted. This will be used to measure the success rate of installing an eSIM profile when the input is valid and external dependencies are operating without errors.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.InstallationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of an attempt to install an eSIM profile either via a QR code or via policy. This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request to install the profile. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.InstallPendingProfile.Result
histogram.summary:
Tracks the success rate of installing a "pending" eSIM profile found via SM-DS. SM-DS provides all profiles which a carrier has associated with a device's EID; once this occurs, the user has the chance to install one of these pending profiles via the UI. The installation process involves making a network request to the cellular carrier and downloading a profile to the device.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.InstallViaQrCode.DBusResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the dbus result for all eSIM installation attempts. This gets logged only if we receive an unknown hermes response code.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.InstallViaQrCode.OperationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of an attempt to install an eSIM profile via a QR code. This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request to install the profile. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.InstallViaQrCode.Result{OperationType}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the success rate of installing an eSIM profile via a QR code. During this process, the user can either scan a QR code by using the device's webcam or can enter the QR code's decoded contents into a text field manually. Once this occurs, the device contacts the cellular carrier and downloads a profile to the device.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.BlockNonManagedCellularBehavior
histogram.summary: Tracks how often the admin allows only managed cellular networks to connect. This metric is logged for managed, cellular-capable devices when the primary user logs in or when there is an update to the allowOnlyPolicyCellularNetworks policy.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.ConnectionResult.All
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of all connection attempts. A success is emitted when a managed eSIM network becomes connected from a non-connected state. When a managed eSIM network goes from a connecting state to a disconnected state, a shill failure reason is emitted.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.Disconnections
histogram.summary: Tracks when a managed eSIM cellular network is connected and when a managed eSIM cellular network is disconnected without explicit user action.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.ESimInstall.OperationResult{OperationType}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of a various operation type attempt to install a managed eSIM profile via policy. This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request to install the profile. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.EuiccStatusUploadResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of an attempt to upload euicc status to DM server. This metric provides the insights on how often ICCID/SM-DP+ get uploaded to the DM server and whether the upload operation is successful or not.
Emitted once the euicc status upload operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.ResetEuicc.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time taken to complete reset euicc operation.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.ResetEuicc.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of an attempt to reset euicc. This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request to reset EUICC. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process. Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.ServiceAtLogin.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks how many managed eSIM profiles are installed on the devices after a primary user login.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.StatusAtLogin
histogram.summary: Tracks status of managed eSIM cellular networks on the device. The status indicates whether the device has managed or only non-managed or both types of cellular networks. This is logged for managed cellular capable devices when the primary user logs in. This allows us to track what fraction of cellular network usage are controlled by policy.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.Usage.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a managed eSIM cellular network is connected as the only network, or with other network or not connected at all.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Policy.Usage.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks how long users are using a managed eSIM cellular network as the sole network for connectivity on their device.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ProfileDiscovery.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks how long the user needs to wait before profile discovery is complete.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ProfileDownload.ActivationCode.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks the time for a profile to be fully downloaded from a provided activation code.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ProfileDownload.PendingProfile.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks the time for a pending profile to be fully downloaded.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ProfileRenameResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the rate of success of setting a profile nickname.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ProfileUninstallationResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the rate of success of uninstalling a profile.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.RequestPendingProfiles.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks the latency of call to SMDS server. This is emitted when pending eSIM profiles are requested. Call latency is calculated and emitted upon completion of the platform call.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.RequestPendingProfiles.OperationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of an attempt to request pending eSIM profiles (i.e., those found via an SM-DS scan). This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request for the profiles. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.RequestPendingProfiles.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of requesting pending eSIM profiles. Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.ServiceAtLogin.Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2022. This is has been replaced with a new metric that adds information on whether sim locking is allowed or not.
histogram.summary: Tracks how many eSIM profiles are installed on the devices after a primary user login. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-01-15 to 2023-01-28; data may be missing

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.SetupFlowResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the eSIM setup flow when the setup dialog closes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.StatusAtLogin
histogram.summary: Tracks the ESim Cellular network profile status when the primary user logs-in to the device.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.UninstallProfile.OperationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of the high-level operation of uninstalling an eSIM profile. This includes several steps before and after the core step of uninstalling the profile.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.UninstallProfile.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of uninstalling an eSIM profile. Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.Usage.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a ESim cellular network is connected as the only network, or with other network or not connected at all.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.ESim.UserInstall.OperationResult.{InstallType}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of an attempt to install an eSIM profile by the user either via QR code or by manually entering the activation code. This process includes both an attempt to inhibit modem scans as well as a request to install the profile. The metric tracks failures at each step of the process.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.InhibitResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of a cellular device inhibit-uninhibit cycle.
Emitted when uninhibit completes or when any step fails.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.Pin.{SimPinOperation}
histogram.summary: Tracks the rate of success of various pin operations. Note: This histogram was expired from 2022-03-01 to 2022-03-23; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PrepareCellularConnection.OperationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of the high-level operation of preparing a cellular network for a connection. For eSIM networks, this involves several steps such as enabling the profile, each of which can fail or succeed.
Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PSim.OtaActivationResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of attempting to activate a physical SIM card via an Over the Air (OTA) activation. Emitted once the operation completes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PSim.ServiceAtLogin.Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2022. This is has been replaced with a new metric that adds information on whether sim locking is allowed or not.
histogram.summary: Tracks how many pSIM networks are available on the device after a primary user login.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PSim.SetupFlowResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the physical SIM card setup flow when the setup dialog closes.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PSim.StatusAtLogin
histogram.summary: Tracks the PSim Cellular network activation state when the primary user logs-in to the device.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.PSim.Usage.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times an PSim cellular network is connected as the only network, or with other network or not connected at all.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.SimPINLockPolicy.{SimPinOperation}
histogram.obsolete: Replaced this with "Network.Cellular.{SimPinOperation}.SimPINLockPolicy" which emits information on whether the policy is applied or not during the operation.
histogram.summary: Sim PIN Lock policy is applied by enterprise administrators when they want to restrict their users from locking or changing the PIN of their SIM. This metric tracks instances where users have been able to successfully execute lock or change PIN operations on their SIM while this policy is turned on.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{AllowSIMLock}.ESim.ServiceAtLogin.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks how many eSIM profiles are installed on the devices after a primary user login.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{AllowSIMLock}.PSim.ServiceAtLogin.Count
histogram.summary: Tracks how many pSIM networks are available on the device after a primary user login.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimPinOperation}.SimPINLockPolicy
histogram.summary: Sim PIN Lock policy is applied by enterprise administrators when they want to restrict their users from locking or changing the PIN of their SIM. This metric tracks instances where users have been able to successfully execute lock or change PIN operations on their SIM while this policy is turned on.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.CellularSetup.{Result}.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time taken by the user to complete Cellular setup flow of a {SimType} network with result {Result}.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.ConnectionResult.All
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of all connection attempts. A success is emitted when a {SimType} network becomes connected from a non-connected state. When a {SimType} network goes from a connecting state to a disconnected state, a shill failure reason is emitted.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-10-01 to 2023-02-28; data may be missing

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.ConnectionResult.UserInitiated
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of a user initiated connection attempt. Logged when a {SimType} connection succeeds or fails. This histogram logs failure reasons exposed by NetworkConnectionHandler.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.DisconnectByPolicy.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the rate of success of disconnecting the connected unmanaged {SimType} networks when restricting cellular networks is enforced by policy.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.Disconnections
histogram.summary: Tracks when cellular {SimType} network is connected and when cellular network is disconnected without explicit user action. Note: This histogram was expired from 2022-03-01 to 2022-03-23; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.TimeToConnected
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount fo time taken between when cellular device starts and finishes connecting for {SimType} networks.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.{SimType}.Usage.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks how long users are using a {SimType} cellular network as the sole network for connectivity on their device.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.DnsOverHttpsMode
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the DOH mode setting whenever it is read from or changed in Chrome and propagated to shill.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.DnsOverHttpsQuery.HttpErrors
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records an value corresponding to the HTTP status returned when a DNS-over-HTTPS request returns in error.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.NameserverTypes
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the type of plain text nameservers used whenever they are obtained from shill for a given network.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.PlainTextProbe.{Family}.Errors
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records any errors that occur during DNS probes made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the probe completes in error.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.PlainTextProbe.{Family}.FailedRetries
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records number of retries for failing probes. A value will be recorded whenever the probe completes in error.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.PlainTextProbe.{Family}.Results
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the results of the DNS probes made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the probe completes.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.PlainTextProbe.{Family}.ResultsWithRetries
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the results of the DNS probes made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the probe completes. However, on error it is only recorded if it is a consistent error, meaning if it fails even after certain amount of retries.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.PlainTextProbe.{Family}.RetriesUntilSuccess
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records number of retries needed until a successful probe. A value will be recorded whenever the probe completes in success. This metric does not catch consistenly failing probes.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.Query.Failed{Stage}Duration
histogram.summary:
Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the duration of various stages of the resolution process, including the entire time elapsed processing the query. The measurement is started when the resolver first reads the query data from the client and completes when the reply is sent.
This histogram collects data for stages of the query that have resulted in some kind of failure. It's possible that for any single query, both successful and failed stages may exist. The most obvious case is when a resolution step is retried. As such, the total time elapsed will necessarily include zero or more resolution stages which are recorded in the query-type-specific version of this histogram.
A "total" duration will be successful if at least one resolve stage succeeds, but will be recorded as 'failed' if they all do, or if any other stage fails.
All measurements are made within the Resolver class. The "receive" time is recorded in OnDNSQuery(). This is also when the "total" time starts. The "resolve" measurements all start from the Resolve() method, and will stop either in the same method (on failure) or handler applicable to the specific client that was used: HandleAresResult() and HandleCurlResult(). The "reply" time is recorded in the ReplyDNS() method.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.Query.{Stage}Duration
histogram.summary:
Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the duration of various stages of the resolution process, including the entire time elapsed processing the query. The measurement is started when the resolver first reads the query data from the client and completes when the reply is sent.
This histogram collects data for stages of the query that have resulted in success. It's possible that for any single query, both successful and failed stages may exist. The most obvious case is when a resolution step is retried. As such, the total time elapsed will necessarily include zero or more resolution stages which are recorded in the query-type-specific version of this histogram.
A "total" duration will be successful if at least one resolve stage succeeds, but will be recorded as 'failed' if they all do, or if any other stage fails.
All measurements are made within the Resolver class. The "receive" time is recorded in OnDNSQuery(). This is also when the "total" time starts. The "resolve" measurements all start from the Resolve() method, and will stop either in the same method (on failure) or handler applicable to the specific client that was used: HandleAresResult() and HandleCurlResult(). The "reply" time is recorded in the ReplyDNS() method.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Family}Nameservers
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the number of nameserver addresses whenever they are obtained from shill for a given network.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{ProcessType}.Event
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy tracking critical process events, which are emitted when conditions arise that cause fatal or disruptive conditions to the service. This metric is used to monitor the stability of the service and provide detailed insight into failures.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Type}Query.Errors
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records any errors that occur during DNS queries made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the request completes in error.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Type}Query.FailedResolveDuration
histogram.summary:
Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the duration of a failed name resolution as part of an overall query. The measurement is started just before the client resolver (either plaintext or DoH) is run and stopped on its completion.
All measurements are made within the Resolver class. The "resolve" measurements all start from the Resolve() method, and will stop either in the same method (on failure) or handler applicable to the specific client that was used: HandleAresResult() and HandleCurlResult().

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Type}Query.ResolveDuration
histogram.summary:
Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the duration of a successful name resolution as part of an overall query. The measurement is started just before the client resolver (either plaintext or DoH) is run and stopped on its completion.
All measurements are made within the Resolver class. The "resolve" measurements all start from the Resolve() method, and will stop either in the same method (on failure) or handler applicable to the specific client that was used: HandleAresResult() and HandleCurlResult().

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Type}Query.Results
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the results of the DNS queries made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the request completes.

histogram.name: Network.DnsProxy.{Type}Query.ResultsWithRetries
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS DNS proxy that records the results of the DNS queries made by the service. A value will be recorded whenever the request completes. If there are retries, only the last result will be recorded.

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.Policy.OncRecommendedFieldsWorkaroundAction
histogram.summary: The action taken when evaluating whether a workaround should be applied to mark Ethernet ONC Policy fields as Recommended for backward compatiblity. This histogram is emitted when the DeviceOpenNetworkConfiguration policy is parsed (on chrome start and policy updates) and is found to contain an Ethernet network configuration.

histogram.name: Network.Mdns.{ServiceType}
histogram.summary: Number of mDNS packets sent for mDNS queries in support of different services. The individual enum values indicate whether the query is an initial query or a refresh query.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.ARC.ActiveTime
histogram.summary: Percentage of time WiFi multicast packets are forwarded from ChromeOS to ARC. This depends on ARC WiFi multicast lock state and ARC doze mode state. The metric is only emitted when ARC is running and WiFi is connected. The value is recorded for a network whenever it is disconnected.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.ARC.WiFi.{Protocol}.ActiveCount
histogram.summary: Amount of WiFi multicast packets received by ChromeOS when multicast packets are forwarded to ARC and WiFi is connected. The value is recorded every 2 minutes by ChromeOS's patchpanel. The metrics are separated by multicast protocol mDNS and SSDP.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.ARC.WiFi.{Protocol}.InactiveCount
histogram.summary: Amount of WiFi multicast packets received by ChromeOS when multicast packets are not forwarded to ARC and WiFi is connected. The value is recorded every 2 minutes by ChromeOS's patchpanel. The metrics are separated by multicast protocol mDNS and SSDP.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.TotalCount
histogram.summary: Amount of multicast packets received by ChromeOS. The value is recorded every 2 minutes by ChromeOS's patchpanel. Only multicast protocols mDNS and SSDP are included.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.{Technology}.ConnectedCount
histogram.summary: Amount of multicast packets received by ChromeOS when at least one network of the specified technology (ethernet or WiFi) is connected. When there are multiple networks of the same technology, the sum is reported. The value is recorded every 2 minutes by ChromeOS's patchpanel. Only multicast protocols mDNS and SSDP are included.

histogram.name: Network.Multicast.{Technology}.{Protocol}.ConnectedCount
histogram.summary: Amount of multicast packets received by ChromeOS when at least one network of the specified technology (ethernet or WiFi) is connected. When there are multiple networks of the same technology, the sum is reported. The value is recorded every 2 minutes by ChromeOS's patchpanel. The metrics are separated by multicast protocol mDNS and SSDP.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalDetectorHasProxy
histogram.summary: Whether a proxy is configured when Chrome captive portal detection completes. This will be used to help prioritize better captive portal detection with a proxy configured.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalDetectorResult
histogram.summary: Chrome captive portal detection results on ChromeOS. NOTE: This metric used to be CaptivePortal.NetworkPortalDetectorResult which was expired from 2021-09-27 to 2022-09-18.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalDetectorRunCount
histogram.summary: Number of Chrome portal detection attempts per network connection on ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalDetectorType
histogram.summary: Captive portal detection network type recorded when Chrome on ChromeOS detects a captive portal. NOTE: This metric used to be CaptivePortal.NetworkPortalDetectorType which was expired from 2021-09-27 to 2022-09-18.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalNotificationState
histogram.summary: Captive portal detection state when a notification is shown. Can be used with Network.NetworkPortalSigninMode to compare notification to signin ratio.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalSigninMode
histogram.summary: Captive portal signin display mode when a UI element requests to show the signin UI. See also NetworkPortalSigninSource.

histogram.name: Network.NetworkPortalSigninSource
histogram.summary: Captive portal signin display source (notification, settings, etc.) when a UI element requests to show the signin UI. See also NetworkPortalSigninMode.

histogram.name: Network.Patchpanel.ArcService
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for ChromeOS patchpanel's ArcService which controls the virtual network setup for ARC++ and ARCVM. This metrics is recorded when the virtual network setup for ARC or ARCVM is created, deleted, or updated to track success and error rates of the various platform operations (network interface creation, iptables setup, etc) involved in the ARC virtual network setup.

histogram.name: Network.Patchpanel.Dbus
histogram.summary: Diagnostic metric for the Dbus APIs implemented by ChromeOS patchpanel network service. This metrics is recorded whenever one of patchpanel DBus APIs is called and tracks success and error rates of various network platform primitives implemented by patchpanel (port forwarding APIs, firewall APIs, virtual network APIs for ARC and crosvm, etc).

histogram.name: Network.Patchpanel.Tethering.CreateTetheredNetwork
histogram.summary: Result of creating a DownstreamNetwork tethered to an upstream network when calling the patchpanel DBus API CreateTetheredNetwork.

histogram.name: Network.Patchpanel.Tethering.DHCPServer
histogram.summary: DHCP server events happening for the DHCP server set up by the patchpanel DBus API CreateTetheredNetwork.

histogram.name: Network.PortalSuspectedToOnlineTime
histogram.summary: Captive portal time from a portal-suspected state to an online state on ChromeOS. NOTE: Prior to M110 this used a range that was too small so those results are invalid.

histogram.name: Network.RedirectFoundToOnlineTime
histogram.summary: Captive portal time from a redirect-found state to an online state on ChromeOS. NOTE: Prior to M110 this used a range that was too small so those results are invalid.

histogram.name: Network.SharedDictionary.EncodingType
histogram.summary: For each shared dictionary network transaction, record the encoding type.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.3GPPRegistrationDelayedDrop
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of cellular network flakes. A network flake occurs when the signal strength goes below detection level for a short duration.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTotalTime
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the total amount of time spent from the start of the first auto-connect request until when the cellular modem successfully connects to the network.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2022-01-30 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTries
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of auto-connect tries that were attempted before the cellular modem successfully connected to the network.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2022-01-30 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ConnectResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Cellular connection attempts through the platform layers. This captures any success or failure as a result of a Connect call through ModemManager, or any causes of early failure in shill that prevents a connect attempt altogether. Refer to go/cros-cellular-apn-metrics for details. This metric was replaced by Network.Shill.Cellular.ConnectResult.{ApnType} in R116.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ConnectResult.{ApnType}
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Cellular connection attempts through the platform layers when using the {ApnType}. This captures any success or failure as a result of a Connect call through ModemManager, or any causes of early failure in shill that prevents a connect attempt altogether. Refer to go/cros-cellular-apn-metrics for details.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the presence of a Cellular device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.Drop
histogram.summary: ChromeOS cellular network metric that tracks the number of drops based on the network technology.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.EntitlementCheck
histogram.summary: ChromeOS cellular network metric that tracks the entitlement check results used for hotspot. This metric is triggered every time the user tries to enable hotspot using cellular as the upstream technology.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a cellular network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.NetworkConnectionIPType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the types of IP configuration used for establishing cellular connections.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalResult
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for a cellular network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ServiceErrors
histogram.summary: ChromeOS connection manager service errors for cellular interface. NOTE: This metric was updated in M101. Data prior to that may be missing.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.SignalStrengthBeforeDrop
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the signal strength (0-100) of the cellular modem before it dropped from the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the time spent using cellular to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to join a cellular network and configure Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to connect a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToDisable
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to disable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToEnable
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to enable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToRedirectFound
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is in a captive portal with a valid redirect URL after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToScan
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to scan a cellular network and register a modem.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.ConnectionDiagnosticsIssue
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks Layer 3 connectivity issues diagnosed by the ConnectionDiagnostics class in Shill ran on a connected network after Shill portal detection has failed to validate the network. This metric is logged each time a ConnectionDiagnostics object completes its diagnostics actions and reports the results to its caller.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the presence of an Ethernet device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.Driver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric that records the name of ethernet driver detected when an ethernet network is started.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for an Ethernet network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalResult
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an Ethernet network.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.ServiceErrors
histogram.summary: ChromeOS connection manager service errors for ethernet interface. NOTE: This metric was updated in M101. Data prior to that may be missing.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeOnline
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network metric sampling the time spent using Ethernet to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease).
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize an Ethernet device.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToRedirectFound
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal with a valid redirect URL after configuring Layer 3 state.
NOTE: This metric was expired from 2021-12-01 to 2022-04-01.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetectionMultiProbeResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 6/2022 because it is unmonitored and not technology specific. TODO(b/236386653): Remove entirely once removed from Shill.
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric recording portal detection results of both the HTTP and HTTPS probes. This is recorded every time a portal detection trial finishes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AggregateResult.{Technology}
histogram.summary: Result of ChromeOS network validation aggregated over multiple attempts until Internet connectivity has been validated or until disconnection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToDisconnect.Cellular
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before a Cellular network transitions to a non connected state, recorded when Service.State transitions to a non connected state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToDisconnect.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before an Ethernet network transitions to a non connected state, recorded when Service.State transitions to a non connected state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToDisconnect.Wifi
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before a WiFi network transitions to a non connected state, recorded when Service.State transitions to a non connected state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToOnline.Cellular
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts until a Cellular network transitions to online, recorded when detection completes with an online result.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToOnline.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts until an Ethernet network transitions to online, recorded when detection completes with an online result.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToOnline.Wifi
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts until a WiFi network transitions to online, recorded when detection complets with an online result.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToRedirectFound.Cellular
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before a Cellular network transitions to redirect-found, recorded when Service.State transitions to redirect-found.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToRedirectFound.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before an Ethernet network transitions to redirect-found, recorded when Service.State transitions to redirect-found.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.AttemptsToRedirectFound.Wifi
histogram.summary: Number of portal detection attempts before a WiFi network transitions to redirect-found, recorded when Service.State transitions to redirect-found.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.InitialResult.Cellular
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection initial result for a Cellular network, recorded after the initial portal detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.InitialResult.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection initial result for an Ethernet network, recorded after the initial portal detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.InitialResult.Wifi
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection initial result for a WiFii network, recorded after the initial portal detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.RepeatResult.Cellular
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection retry result for a Cellular network, recorded after a repeated detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.RepeatResult.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection retry result for an Ethernet network, recorded after a repeated detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.RepeatResult.Wifi
histogram.summary: Shill captive portal detection retry result for a WiFi network, recorded after a repeated detection attempt.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.{AttemptResult}Duration.{Technology}
Network.Shill.PortalDetector.{ProbeType}Duration.{Technology}
histogram.summary: Duration of a single HTTP or HTTPS probe sent on a {Technology} network as part of ChromeOS platform portal detection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PortalDetector.{Transition}.{Technology}
histogram.summary: Total time it takes for ChromeOS network validation to find a captive portal redirection or to validate Internet access starting from the initial network connection ("TimeToRedirect, "TimeToInternet") or starting from the first discovery of a captive portal redirection ("TimeToInternetAfterRedirect").

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PPPMTUValue
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the MTU value provided by the upstream PPP peer for L2TP VPN connections. A sample is emitted each time the client successfully negotiates an MTU value via PPP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionTimeTaken
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes suspend actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TimeToDrop
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.Driver
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the VPN connection type.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.Ikev2.AuthenticationType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful IKEv2 VPN connection that tracks how the client authenticates itself to the server.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.Ikev2.EndReason
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on the end of each IKEv2 VPN connection that tracks the reason that the connection is ended. This metric will be emitted no matter if the connection is established successfully, i.e., it will be emitted if an error happens during connecting.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.L2tpIpsec.SwanctlEndReason
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on the end of each L2TP/IPsec VPN connection initiated by the swanctl-based driver that tracks the reason that the connection is ended. This metric will be emitted no matter if the connection is established successfully, i.e., it will be emitted if an error happens during connecting.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.L2tpIpsecTunnelGroupUsage
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful L2TP/IPsec VPN connection that tracks whether tunnel group is used. The tunnel group property needs to be set when connecting to some Cisco L2TP/IPsec VPN.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.OpenVPNCipher
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric emitted on each successful OpenVPN connection that tracks the cipher algorithm negotiated with server.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.RemoteAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the remote authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the time spent using VPN to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular). A sample is emitted every time the system transitions from primary connectivity through a VPN to some other type of connectivity. The value of the sample is the time delta in seconds from the instant the system transitioned to VPN connectivity.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a VPN network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a VPN connection is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.UserAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the user authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.WireGuardAllowedIPsType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful WireGuard VPN connection that tracks the type of the allowed IPs set in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.WireGuardKeyPairSource
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful WireGuard VPN connection that tracks the source of the key pair used in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.WireGuardPeersNum
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful WireGuard VPN connection that tracks the number of peers used in in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.EspEncryptionAlgorithm
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the encryption algorithm used by the ESP protocol in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.EspIntegrityAlgorithm
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the integrity algorithm used by the ESP protocol in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.IkeDHGroup
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the DH group used by the IKE protocol in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.IkeEncryptionAlgorithm
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the encryption algorithm used by the IKE protocol in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.IkeIntegrityAlgorithm
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the integrity algorithm used by the IKE protocol in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.{VPNType}.IPType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric emitted on each successful {VPNType} VPN connection that tracks the IP family provided in this connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AdapterAllowlisted
histogram.summary: ChromeOS WiFi usage metric emitted every time the WiFi adapter is enabled. It tracks if the adapter that was detected on the device is in the allowlist to be reported via structured metrics (e.g. is it in AVL?) or not.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Ap80211kSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support the 802.11k standard, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Ap80211rSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support the 802.11r standard, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Ap80211vBSSMaxIdlePeriodSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support the 802.11v BSS Max Idle Period feature, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Ap80211vBSSTransitionSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support the 802.11v BSS Transition feature, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Ap80211vDMSSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support the 802.11v DMS feature, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApAlternateEDCASupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support transmit opportunity negotation, emitted on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApChannelSwitch
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled when an AP switches channels. Shows the old frequency band and the new frequency band.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the AP disconnects a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Broad category of reason AP disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApSCSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support stream classification, emitted on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AssocFailureType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Status code reported when an 802.11 association fails. Note that not all disconnects are caused by an assoc failure, and so this metric shold not be correlated with the DisconnectType metrics.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AuthFailureType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Status code reported when an 802.11 authentication fails. Note that not all disconnects are caused by an auth failure, and so this metric should not be correlated with the DisconnectType metrics.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AutoConnectableServices
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of wifi services available for auto-connect when auto-connect is initiated for wifi device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AvailableBSSesAtConnect
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of BSSes (endpoints) available for the currently connecting wifi service.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.BadPassphraseServiceType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. This is recorded when a connection failure is due to bad-passphrase and indicates whether the attempt is initated by users or not and if the service has been previously connected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.BSSTransitionManagementSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric recording BSS Transition Management statuses. This is recorded every time a BSS Transition Management request is received from a wireless access point.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Channel
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. The channel used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.CiscoAdaptiveFTSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of Wireless Access Points that support Cisco's Adaptive FT feature, sampled on successful connections to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the client disconnects a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. Broad category of reason client disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.CQMNotification
histogram.summary: ChromeOS Wifi Connection Quality Monitor(CQM) Notifications metric. This is emitted when any packet or beacon loss is observed for signal strength greater than -80 dBm. This metric is rate-limited such that it is never emitted more than once every 6 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the presence of a WiFi device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Disconnect
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric that tracks whether an 802.11 wireless network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapInnerProtocol
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured inner authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapOuterProtocol
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured outer authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiFi network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.FallbackDNSTestResult
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric that tracks the result of the fallback DNS test. The fallback DNS test is performed when portal detection failed due to DNS failure.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Hidden.EverConnected
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric tracking whether there has ever been a successful connection for each WiFi network which is configured with a hidden SSID. The metric includes networks from system and user profile and it's recorded each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in. Networks that were last connected before M-84 will show as never connected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Hidden.LastConnected
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric tracking the number of days since the last connection for each WiFi network configured with hidden SSID. The metric includes networks from system and user profile and it's recorded each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.HiddenSSIDEverConnected
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric tracking whether WiFi networks configured with hidden SSID have ever been connected. The metric includes networks from system and user profile and it's recorded each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.HiddenSSIDNetworkCount
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric tracking WiFi networks configured with hidden SSID. The metric includes networks from system and user profile and it's recorded each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in. The fraction of non-zero buckets should roughly correspond to the fraction of devices that are trying to connect to hidden SSIDs at any given point in time.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.HS20Support
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the Hotspot 2.0 support of access points that devices connect to. Results are recorded every time a device connects to an access point. The metric records either the HS20 version the AP supports, or that the AP does not support HS20.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.MBOSupport
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the Multi-Band Operation (MBO) support of access points that devices connect to. Results are recorded every time a device connects to an access point.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.NeighborLinkMonitorFailure
histogram.summary: ChromeOS metric that signals the type of failure the NeighborLinkMonitor detected on 802.11 wireless network. Recorded after the NeighborLinkMonitor detects a layer 2 connectivity failure to a neighbor.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.NetworkConnectionIPType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric that tracks the types of IP configuration used for establishing WiFi connections.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.NetworkProblemDetected
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network performance metric that tracks the network problems encountered by TrafficMonitor after WiFi connection is established.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.ConnectionResult
histogram.summary: Results of a WiFi connection attempt for a WiFi network provisioned through Passpoint.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.Domains
histogram.summary: Number of FQDNs specified in a Passpoint profile. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.HomeOis
histogram.summary: Number of Home Organization Identifiers specified in a Passpoint profile. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.InterworkingDurationMillis
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of a single supplicant Interworking select operation.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.InterworkingMatches
histogram.summary: Number of Passpoint match events during a single supplicant Interworking select operation.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.Match
histogram.summary: Match event between a Passpoint profile provisioned in shill and a Passpoint network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.Meteredness
histogram.summary: Meterdness configuration of Passpoint profiles. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.Origin
histogram.summary: Origin of a Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.ProvisioningResult
histogram.summary: Result of a Passpoint profile provisioning operation in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.RemovalResult
histogram.summary: Result of a Passpoint profile removal operation in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.RequiredHomeOis
histogram.summary: Number of required Home Organization Identifiers specified in a Passpoint profile. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.RoamingOis
histogram.summary: Number of Roaming Organization Identifiers specified in a Passpoint profile. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.SavedCredentials
histogram.summary: Number of Passpoint profiles saved in a shill user profile. Recorded once every time a user profile is loaded in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.Passpoint.Security
histogram.summary: EAP method configuration of Passpoint profiles. Recorded once per Passpoint profile successfully provisioned in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.PasspointNetworkCount
histogram.summary: Number of savd WiFi networks provisioned through Passpoint. Recorded once every time a user profile is loaded in shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PhyMode
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric. The standard advertised by the AP for each successful WiFi connection. It is not necessarily the same as the standard used by the AP and STA to communicate. For example, if the AP supports 802.11ax and the STA only supports 802.11ac, this metric will report 802.11ax even though STA and AP will use 802.11ac. The metric is emitted when the device connects successfully to an AP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalResult
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RegulatoryDomain
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network usage metric that tracks which country the WiFi regulatory domain is set to. Recorded every time a WiFi regulatory domain change is triggered or determined initially (Shill startup).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedNetworkCount
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks known by the connection manager at the time a configuration profile has been loaded. A configuration profile is loaded at each system startup, and when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedSystemNetworkCount
histogram.summary:
ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks configured from the system configuration profile. This metric is sampled each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.
It might be surprising to have a system configuration profile metric sampled when a user configuration profile is loaded. But this ensures that we have equal numbers of samples for system and user configuration profiles.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedUserNetworkCount
histogram.summary: ChromeOS network metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks configured from a user configuration profile. This metric is sampled each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RestartReason
